### Winter Storm Warning

All City of Allen facilities will be closed Saturday and Sunday due to expected winter weather. Visit the [Winter Weather Center](https://www.cityofallen.org/community/winter_weather_preparedness/index.php) for the latest updates.

[Read More](https://www.cityofallen.org/top_alert_detail_T49_R1.php)

* Allen City Council

Allen City Council
==================

The City of Allen operates under a council-manager form of government, approved by voters in 1979 through the adoption of the Allen City Charter. The Allen City Council consists of the mayor and six councilmembers, all elected citywide, not by district. Both the mayor and councilmembers serve staggered three-year terms.

[Meet Your Council](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/index.php#councilbio)  [Agendas and Minutes](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/index.php#Agendas)  [Attend a Meeting](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/index.php#Attend)  [Watch Public Meetings](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/watch_public_meetings.php)  [Request a Letter/Proclamation](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/mayoral_proclamation.php) 

---

What Does the City Council Do?
------------------------------

The City Council is responsible for:

* Setting city policy
* Enacting ordinances (municipal laws)
* Approving the annual budget
* Regulating zoning and development
* Appointing board and commission members
* Engaging in strategic planning for the city's future

[Back to top](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/index.php#top)  

---

City Council Meeting Agendas and Minutes
----------------------------------------

* **Agendas:** Available online at least three business days prior to the meeting. A paper copy is posted outside Allen City Hall in the public notice case by the main entrance. [View upcoming agendas.](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_meeting_agendas_minutes.php)
* **Minutes:** Once approved, meeting minutes are archived and accessible online. [View meeting minutes.](http://publicrecords.cityofallen.org/WebLink/Browse.aspx?startid=37&_ga=2.234898561.1249868647.1722832009-1843159995.1722662409&cr=1)
* **Previous agendas:** Available online through NovusAGENDA. [View previous agendas.](https://allen.novusagenda.com/agendapublic/)

[Back to top](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/index.php#top)  

---

Attending Meetings and Addressing the City Council
--------------------------------------------------

City Council meetings are held on the second and fourth Tuesday of each month at 7 p.m. in the Council Chambers at Allen City Hall, 305 Century Parkway. Prior to the meeting, there’s a workshop at 6 p.m. in the Council Conference Room. Both the meetings and workshops are open to the public.

### How to Speak at a Council Meeting

You can address the City Council on both agenda and non-agenda items. Here’s how:

* **Submit a form online:** The [Public Speaker Request Form](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=D-ZxTzEcxUWhNtqHVXCaeGmU7_1vIepOgbwpgNX9pypUQVFSRUpNQlVQT1IxMlY5UzRRMkJZRUxHMS4u) is available online starting the Friday before the meeting at 5 p.m. and until 5 p.m. on the meeting day. After 5 p.m., paper forms are available in the Council Chambers.
* **Submit your form in person:** Paper forms must be handed to the City Secretary before the meeting begins.
* **Speak at the podium:** When called, go to the podium, state your name and address for the record, and discuss your topic. Groups are encouraged to select one spokesperson.

Note: Due to legal restrictions, the Council cannot take immediate action on non-agenda items but may refer the issue for further study or place it on a future agenda.  
  
[Back to top](https://www.cityofallen.org/government/city_council/index.php#top)
